>So said kartikdg on 2003-05-20 --------------------
>Hi,
>I would like to =
deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and 
>actualResult)
>using JUnit.
>
=
>JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2) 
>wh=
ich compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep 
>comparison=
.

Incorrect. It uses the equals method. What the equals method is up to wh=
o wrote the classes whose objects are compared.

>Since the expectedResult =
and actualResult will never have the same
>reference, does anyone have any =
idea on how to perform a deep 
>comparison comparing the values of 2 object=
s) ?

Implement equals on the class under test.
